page.title: 09SUPERNATURAL, CHITTERNE
page.content: Chitterne is located in an area rich in archaelogical remains and tales of supernatural occurences in the area are numerous. In the village itself one of the most haunted locations is "The Gatehouse". It was once a halfway rest house for clerics travelling between Lacock Abbey and Amesbury Abbey. One night a coach arrived and a young stable lad ran out to help. Unfortunately he was run down and killed by the horses.A cross gouged in the wall commemorates the accident and his ghost has been reported several times. Recently in the house itself a young woman working there saw an old lady in a long grey dress standing in the doorway, then she appeared sitting on a chaise longue. When the young woman spoke to her she disappeared in an icy blast of air.
